body:
Oh, BigDecimal wants a string instead of an integer on ruby 1.8.

```diff
diff --git a/activerecord/test/cases/relation/where_test.rb b/activerecord/test/cases/relation/where_test.rb
index 0529945..ba9df16 100644
--- a/activerecord/test/cases/relation/where_test.rb
+++ b/activerecord/test/cases/relation/where_test.rb
@@ -52,7 +52,7 @@ module ActiveRecord
     end
 
     def test_where_with_decimal_for_string_column
-      count = Post.where(:title => BigDecimal.new(0)).count
+      count = Post.where(:title => BigDecimal.new('0')).count
       assert_equal 0, count
     end
 
```

That probably needs to be fixed on 3-0-stable, 3-1-stable, 3-2-stable and master.  Should I open a new pull request for each with that change?
